模仿文本： Gaza is but one global hotspot focusing the world's attention. Secretary Kerry reviewed what the Obama administration knows about what brought down a commercial jetliner over eastern Ukraine.
Kerry blasted separatists for rummaging in debris fields and impeding the arrival of international investigators, and said Russia, as the separatists' main benefactor, bears much responsibility for the tragedy.加沙不过只是一个聚集了全世界关注的热点地区。其他方面，国务卿克里重申了奥巴马政府对在乌克兰东部上空击落商用客机元凶的看法。
克里炮轰分裂分子在破坏飞机残骸区域，阻碍国际调查员的进入，并指出分裂分子的主要资助人俄罗斯对此次悲剧负有很大责任。

description:
本节目为沪江部落一档美语发音模仿节目，每期节目选取30秒左右的慢速VOA新闻内容，主持人亲自朗读示范模仿发音，对发音要点进行讲解，并配以详细的语音语调示意图，手把手教你练就地道美音范儿！想要得到主持人专业的点评和意见吗？去沪江部落订阅本节目！

今日主持人：曲值

28秒音频：

模仿文本：The SAT is one of two major tests for entrance to American colleges and universities. The other test is called the ACT. Test scores help colleges decide if a candidate can succeed at their schools. More than 2 million students take the SAT yearly. They include about 100,000 foreign students.

译文：学术能力评估测试是美国两种大学入学考试之一。另一种是美国大学考试。测试得分有助于各学校判断一位申请者能否在校表现优异。每年，超过两百万名考生参加学术能力评估测试，这其中约有10万名为外国考生。

小编模仿：

单词细节：

en·trance noun \ˈen-trən(t)s\
Amer·i·can noun \ə-ˈmer-ə-kən, -ˈmər-, -ˈme-rə-\
uni·ver·si·ty noun \ˌyü-nə-ˈvər-sə-tē, -ˈvər-stē\
can·di·date noun \ˈkan-də-ˌdāt, ˈka-nə-, -dət\
suc·ceed verb \sək-ˈsēd\
school noun \ˈskül\
hun·dred noun \ˈhən-drəd, -dərd\

description:
《英文天天写》是沪江部落一档写作类节目，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Hover
To hover means to float in the air or linger around. Who or what is hovering? Why? Where does the hovering take place?
This week's topic: It hovers in mid-air... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) a rescue helicopter hovering during a rescue mission
2) an amphibian hovercraft about to take-off
3) children hovering around their parents, wanting to get the toys they want
4) a drone hovering in the target area
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

Sean felt full; he tried every single thing on the tables and then more. He especially enjoyed his time with the chocolate fountain. He hovered around to check and see if he missed anything. Suddenly, he felt a light tap on his shoulder. “When did you get here?” Sean turned around as he heard the person asked. The masked stranger grinned. Naturally, Sean thought the person was being friendly, and failed to realize the fact that instead of a latte mustache, his lips were stained with dark chocolate from the strawberry fondue.

title: 英文天天写：Hover

description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！

【歌曲信息】


粉红佳人 P!nk，原名Alecia Beth Moore，美国知名歌手，唱作人，动物保护者以及女权主义者。前期风格以R&B、Hip-Hop、Ballads为主，后期转向Pop/Rock（流行/摇滚）。16岁以白人女子R&B组合Choice主唱身份签约Laface，两年半后单飞。继2000年初首支单曲There You Go以来， P!nk一共发行了6张录音室专辑以及一张精选专辑，并获得了全球总销量超过3800万的骄人成绩。其桀骜不驯的形象深得女性的喜爱。出道13年以来，P!nk一共获得了4首Billboard Hot 100冠单，14首Top10，19首Top20单曲，三座格莱美以及五座MTV音乐录影带大奖。2009年末，P!nk被美国Billboard杂志评选为2000-2009年度流行艺人第一名。

她是一个常有着惊世装扮，性感劲酷的新世代辣妹。自信、率真、直言不讳的P!nk就是这样一个中气十足的女生。她以自己重节奏风格和桀骜不驯的性格深受美国青少年喜爱。一位留着亮丽粉红色短发（现在是银白色），一身酷炫装扮的新时代辣妹Pink，有着菲律宾的血统，却在法国尼斯举办的超级模特儿选秀表演会上一鸣惊人而被唱片公司发掘，并成为新时代酷炫乐团TLC的师妹。不同的是，虽然有着类似的外表，但除了酷似TLC以重节奏的Hip-Hop舞曲为主外，Pink更唱出足以和Janet Jackson、Toni Braxton媲美的节奏蓝调情歌，尤其在转音和浑厚的嗓音运用上，也令人惊讶不已，是以让LaFace将其视为秘密武器。

虽然年纪轻轻才30岁，Pink却已被媒体赞誉为“下一个麦当娜”。纵然这个推论尚言之过早，但这位顶着粉红惊世发色的女歌手，确实已经撂下了“我要接收全世界，然后把它漆成粉红色”这样的豪语。自信、率真、直言不讳，Pink常说她的主要目的就是打破陈规。而身为一位在人才济济的节奏蓝调乐坛中打拼的白人女歌手，事实上她可说已经粉碎了这个主战场中既有的惯例了。

Pink艺名的来历：Pink7岁时她因在夏令营中被顽皮的男孩当众扯下裤子并大喊“看呐！她变成粉红色啦！”而从此得到了“Pink”这个绰号。14岁在俱乐部里担任歌手，正式使用的艺名：P!nk

Made a wrong turn, once or twice

一两次的 做了坏决定

Dug my way out, blood and fire

血流淋漓的为了找到出路

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Fucking Perfect

description:
When it comes to disease, there're few more emotive than cancer. In fact, cancer is not one disease at all, but many different disorders in different organs that behave in different ways. Mike Stratton is a doctor who evolved into a cancer biologist by exploring the complexities of DNA when it goes wrong.

Well we know that all cancers originally arise from one abnormal cell that has gone to the bad that started to grow when it shouldn't grow to proliferate and to invade. And the reason that that happens is because mutations have accumulated in that single cell, mutations in particular set of genes that we call cancer genes. Those mutations in the cancer genes convert that normal cell into a cancer cell. But when I started working as a pathologist, we only knew one of those genes. And our sense was that there were many more of these mutated cancer genes that were accounting for the development of the 100 to 200 different types of cancer in the various different tissues of the body. So I became fascinated with the exploration that I could see was gonna have to take place in the decades to come to systematically explore the genomes of cancer cells in order to find these cancer-causing mutations.

title: 癌症不是一种病（有声）
